message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $20000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better price anywhere else. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $15000. Would you be willing to meet me at this price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm afraid I can't meet you at $15000. I'm willing to make a counteroffer of $18000. This is a fair price considering the product's value and uniqueness. What do you think?
I'm still not convinced that $18000 is the right price for this product. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering $16000. Can you consider this price?

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm still not comfortable with $16000. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my previous offer, so I'm counteroffering $17500. This is the best I can do. What do you think?
I'm getting close to my budget, but I still think $17500 is a bit steep. I'm willing to meet you at $16500, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Can you consider this price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. However, I'm still not comfortable with $16500. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering $17000. This is my final offer. What do you think?

I've made a significant concession by offering $16500, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm sticking to my previous offer of $16500. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.
